results.description: Calling all brain hackers. Let's come together! To anyone interested in learning about, working with, and/or developing OpenBCI hardware and software, this Meetup group is for you. OpenBCI is an open-source, programable brain-computer interface, and we want to teach you how to use it, and for you to help us improve it! Join us; let's collaborate on the many challenges faced in designing more practical brain-computer interfaces. The possibilities are endless. From application dev, to software dev, to hardware improvements, to electrode design, to 3D headset modeling/printing... the list goes on and on! As our community continues to grow, so do the possibilities of what we can discover and create. What can we build together?
results.name: OpenBCI Workshop

results.description:
I started this group as a way for other trail junkies and backpackers from around the North East and beyond to get together and enjoy the outdoors.

For the entire ~500 miles of my 2013 Appalachian Trail section hike I chose to hammock camp.  Being a hammock fan for a couple of years prior, it was during those miles that I really became passionate about hammocks.  During that same year I bought a sewing machine, took several classes, and started making my own hammocks for fun.

If you're a hammocker or a ground dweller, come and join us on day hike or a multiple-day backpacking trip where you will make some new trail buddies and burn some calories.

results.description: I am a professional screenwriter with projects in active development. I'm looking for people who are interested in committing to the group for a minimum of 10 weeks so as to create continuity.  Please join the group if you meet the following criteria: 1) you are an experienced screenwriter who understands the basics of completing a feature length screenplay 2) you are tired of starting projects and not finishing them - you want someone else to hold you accountable for finishing what you start 3) you have at least one idea that you would like to develop into a completed screenplay 4) you are open to making this group (and the writing process) of a priority in your life 5) you are able to meet once a week in Manhattan for 3-4 hours. This group is to provide companionship and support to you in all of your ventures and adventures. There is no need to be alone; whatever you want to do, we will do it with you. The one rule is you must in turn be just as supportive to other group members. This group is to help create real friendships and a loving communal environment. It is for people who like to communicate and share, people who like learning about and accepting differences of others. If you want to let your guard down and just live, then this group is for you. Do you have, friends that don't do the things you like to do, no friends, are you new to the area, or love making new friends...then this group is for you.

Each week a member will have the opportunity to suggest and host something she wants to do, read a book together, debate and idea, travel to a crazy place, make a video, whatever it is YOU NAME IT we will do it.  

We will support each other, learn something new, but especially learn how to work with and be supportive of one another.  Don't speak about it be about it; let's do it ladies.  There are too many people on this planet to be alone.


Hello , fellow Adventurers,
I am no longer MIA.  I have attached a video which has been uploaded to YouTube. I hope that you all can find some time to watch it; it is about 7 mins long.
After watching it please do not forget to inbox me as soon as possible with a day you would prefer to meet...Fri, or Sat.
 
I look forward to us meeting and making great use of this group. I apologize for my absence as there were some unforeseen events that took precedence.
I guess we need to make up for lost time!! LOL

results.description:
Join us, and learn what you are capable of by training Krav Maga. Krav Maga is a close quarters self-defensive fighting system. It is simple, brutal, and effective. It is based on practical movements, that minimize contact, and allow you to disable your opponent. 

There are 3 principles to remember:

1. We train NOT to fight. 

2. We avoid a fight, unless the consequences of disengaging are life threatening.

3. If there are no other options, fight to kill!


Although, this sounds scary, we make it fun. Remember, we train NOT to fight. As a member, you will become more confident, and more understanding of others as a latent effect. RSVP, today!


Thanks,

Ganesh

topics.name: How to Market Your Business through Blogging

results.description:
Why Join The Blogger Babes Meetup group? 

It can get lonely for anyone trying to blog her way to the top. That’s why we formed The Blogger Babes. It’s not just an  association –  it’s more like a sisterhood. We help each other out, from sharing useful tips  to collaborating with members to create awesome content together.

You’ll benefit from our experienced bloggers - those that have been blogging for quite a while and who actually make a living from their blog - to our handy tips and tools , networking opportunities and the educational webinars we coordinate at least twice a month.

We offer some pretty exciting (and exclusive) stuff:

· Socializing and Networking Opportunities: Hang out with your fellow bloggers, both in person and virtually! We organize parties, meetups and webinars for our Blogger Babes. 

· Exclusive Content: Hone your skills, cultivate new ideas and pick up a few tips with our content – ebooks, articles, webinars and more! Only available to Blogger Babes members.

·Support: The Blogger Babes are a friendly bunch – and we encourage members to reach out to one another, to make friends, collaborate, give encouragement and seek advice from members. You can’t do everything by yourself, and you shouldn’t have to when your fellow blogger babes are such excellent sources of support.

Goodies & Gifts & Sponsored Opportunities: We're continuously working to find sponsors for our bloggers. It's a win-win situation for both parties - our sponsors get exposure and feedback about their products & services, and our bloggers get to try out new products and services for free . This also gives a chance for our newer bloggers to learn how to review products the right way ( yes, there is a right and wrong way to write spectacular product reviews that will keep your sponsors coming back and your readers clamoring for more..).

Does this all sound exciting? Come join us and start blogging better now, and do tell all the other bloggers  in your life to join the Blogger Babes movement.

PS:Make sure you subscribe to our no-cost newsletter at www.bloggerbabes.com to get all of this week’s valuable content in condensed form.
results.name: Blogger Babes NYC + Tristate

This group is for both existing host and new host family who want to join the club and host students. It's for host who want to be part of a group sharing ideas, stories, tips, and even time together to help make each hosting experience an interesting one. 

I started this group because hosting for 15 years, I live a homestay lifestyle. Everything I do revolves around hosting directly and indirectly. There are many other host families in NYC who are doing the same thing but on their own. As a group we can meet for dinner, share stories and advice. Once a year we may even group together and go on an overseas vacation! An urban homestay lifestyle in NYC is positively unique.

results.description:
Central NJ Strategic Design + Tech

Driven to ensure New Jersey is a viable state to start and develop businesses, we are gathering creative technologists to discuss our thriving ecosystem of innovators, educators, engineers, entrepreneurs, policy makers, and the capital community.

Mission

The mission of this group is to support and aid people from all markets and technology areas. Our hope is to help people accelerate the process, and reduce the risk of moving from concept, into production and releasing to the public market. We want to help educate on new ways of designing, prototyping, building and fulfilling tech hardware, software, systems, & components.


We will be focused on:

• Startups, Entrepreneurialism, and Growing Business in NJ

• Strategic Design & Sustainable Business Models

• Disruption and Innovation

• User Experience (UX)

• Manufacturing

• Hardware and Software Engineering

• Maker movement

• Emergent Technology

• Mobile development

• Internet of Things (IoT) and Wearables

• Big Data, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics

• BioTech

• FinTech

• User Interface Design & Information Architecture

• Marketing and Business Networking

• Social Entrepreneurialism

• Civic Engagement and Gov’t Policy

• Workforce Diversity

• Education & Technology (EdTech, 21st Ed)

• Capitalization and Fundraising (VC, angels, crowdfunding)


All meetup discussions will be supplemented with time for hands-on learning workshops. This is a group formed exists to support the startup community .

• Presentations

• Demo Nights

• Hackathons

• Coworking

• Startup Weekends

• Networks

• Show and Tell


Necessary Stakeholders in the EcoSystem - If this is you, come on out:

• Coworking spots

• Developers

• Entrepreneurs

• Designers

• Capital Community

• Educational professionals

• Government leaders


To be clear, we're looking to collaborate with the many other MeetUps in the area and welcome interaction so don't overlap too much and conflict. If you're organizing another MeetUp in this domain, this is another venue for you to network and present your ideas – we welcome the collaboration and conversation with kindred spirits.

results.description:
SAY HELLO TO YOUR NEW FRIENDS.

Our mission is to bring adventure and fun into your life while building lifelong friendships. As Eleanor Roosevelt once said, “the purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” And, that’s exactly what Welcome to Queens is all about! We are a fun group of young professionals with varied interests who are looking to get out, foster new friendships, and enjoy life.

We are a group of young professionals 21-39 looking to explore Queens.

Are you tired of sitting at home? Is it hard to get together with friends who are married or have moved away? Is the weekly bar scene getting boring and old to you? Well you are not alone! Modern day society has caused people to feel completely frazzled and out of sync with nature and enjoying what life has to offer. Get ready to dust off that bucket list and start living life to the fullest!

We pride ourselves in creating and organizing exciting and unique experiences. Have you ever thought what it might be like to be a trapeze circus performer? What about the exciting pastime of exploring wild caves – Spelunking? Or maybe, you’re into some indoor fun such as Dodgeball, Laser Tag, and Slam Dunk Basketball.

Our activities include everything from dinner and drinks and fun nightlife activities, to ski and camping weekend getaways, and everything in between. Do you want to ignite your summer with sky diving, parasailing, fun BBQ’s, and participating in sports activities such as Volleyball and Kickball? Do you have life goals such as running in a Spartan or Survival race? If you are looking to get off of the couch, meet new people, and have a blast, then Welcome to Queens is the group for you.

results.description:
A Billion Entrepreneurs Foundation, Inc. presents: New York Business Meetup Workshop Series

The workshops are based on the successful Business Finishing School curriculum that focuses on the 12 Foundation Principles of Business.

Business Finishing School (“BFS”) is a leading business-growth education company that teaches “next-level” business principles; which are beyond the usual marketing, accounting, and management concepts.

Are you operating at your best inside your business?

Is the business you own (or work for) fully on purpose and hitting all of its objectives?

BFS believes that all businesses should sit firmly on top of the 12 Foundational Principles of Business, in order to maximize potential and growth. BFS has created a blueprint that virtually any motivated entrepreneur, executive, or employee can implement. This blueprint will add systemization and predictability to your growth and profit. By adopting these 12 principles, your organization will increase the probability of long-term success, while leveraging the talents and experience of all involved.

The Business Finishing School team will walk through the steps of a better framework for business and personal success; using an approach which builds on purpose-driven behavior. These events can be used to refocus your business or to plan a new venture the right way from the start. These meetups are a great way to learn about other local resources for entrepreneurs and connect with others who share the same passion for success.
results.name: New York Business Meetup

IdeaCon is a bi-monthly event on focused on Big Ideas in Content Marketing and Content. 

If you're looking to get a pulse on Content Marketing Trends in 2015, and hear thought leaders speak on timely first-hand case studies, join the group and stay tuned.  We usually announce the location two weeks prior, and sign-ups will be limited so stay tuned!

Our panel format generally includes three people from the following types of industries: 

a.) a brand or agency content marketer

b.) a creative, artist, or content maker

c.) a publisher

We start the panel with a challenge that each one is facing and end with an interactive Q&A and the requisite time for drinks and mingling. 

 You’ll be at home in this group if you are:   

 a.) a brand, startup, or individual engaged in storytelling and trying to find an audience.  

b.) a writer, photographer, or multi-media artist looking to build new audience.

“Top of the Morning To You!” - an unusual Sabbath service!

What if you got together with friends, shared some intimate moments, munched great food and “talked meaningful stuff” ?!?

That’s what we are doing.
On a Saturday morning.
We won’t sit in the pews. We won’t call out page numbers.
We will look at some lines of psalms. Talk about our own lives.
Snack on waffles, orange juice,  nibble nuts and babka.
Sit at the table and hear a story. And make meaning out of  
life, modern and ancient.

it will be a shorter service….10:30am-11:45am  (and followed by kugel and Kiddush)

Be part of a grand experiment. Be part of a meaningful get together.
Bring the inner munchies - your soul’s and your tummy’s - home for  morning

to facilitating this get-together

Join our small groups of 6 - 8 people who get together to share business development best practices through peer-to-peer advice from other professionals just like you. Groups are all formed around "compatible networks." We get the right people together who are non-competing but calling on the same target market. All participants are vetted and interviewed to find the best groups for everyone.

Tell us who your customers are and we will place you in the right group who can introduce you to the decision makers you want to meet. 

Our groups help people:

• Further define their target markets

• Perfect their pitch

• Learn their own strengths and weaknesses so they can emphasize strengths and overcome weaknesses

• Express your unique specialty

• Learn "go to market" strategies from people in YOUR market

This is NOT random networking. This is NOT "you never know" marketing.

This IS a proven targeted, thoughtful approach to getting the best unbiased advice PLUS targeted customer referrals from people who can help you the most.

To attend a group, please contact Jonathan Rosen at jonathan@collaberex.com 

www.collaberex.com

results.description:
"Food is more than survival. With it we make friends, court lovers, and count our blessings." - Nat Geo 

This group is intended to bring together food lovers primarily in their 20s and early 30s. The goal is to make new friends, enjoy delicious food, and learn about different cultures. If you have a particular cuisine or restaurant you would like to try, feel free to let us know. We are always looking for cultural ambassadors who can show us their foods. 

DETAILS: We will have both small and large group dinners. 

• Small group (4-6 people) 

• Large group (6-12 people) 

In addition to dinners, to keep things interesting, we will host other events: 

• Coffee/Tea Meetups

• Food Crawls (sampling of food from different restaurants that are within walking distance) 

• Happy Hours/Bar Meetups 

• Karaoke 

• Sports 

• Picnics 

• Comedy Clubs 

• Shows 

• Game Night

RULES: 

1) FEES: We don’t believe in charging people to make friends. However, we also know that inconsiderate RSVPs spoil the experience for everyone. For most events we will charge a $1 maintenance fee, this is not to make money.  The money goes toward the group and covers the monthly website fee.  

2) ATTENDANCE: Most events will be first come first serve. If you RSVP and cannot go, please provide notice a day in advance. Of course, we understand there are emergencies, but please do let us know. 

3) RSVP policy: If you RSVP and cancel the day before the meetup, please send the organizer(s) a message to notify them. If you RSVP and do not show up on occasion depending on the circumstances you may be either suspended from the group for a longer period of time, or removed from the group. Though this may sound harsh, please understand that the organizers put time and effort into planning these meetups. More importantly, this gives others a chance to attend our events. 

4) Profile pictures: Please have a clear photo of yourself when you join. We know you're not actually the NY skyline or a cartoon character.  :)

Thank you and we look forward to meeting you all!
results.name: NYC Young Food Lovers

results.description:

If you are queer and not afraid to let your inner dork hang out, this group is for you.  We meet pretty regularly to play Cards Against Humanity, Head's Up, Jenga, and other games. Other potential activities include theater, laser tag, stand-up comedy, trivia, dinners and cocktail hours, movie night, karaoke, etc.   Most of our events are in Chelsea or mid-Manhattan Island.

My original intention in starting this group was to make friends with people who like doing the same things I do.  So far, it has worked out great, but to preserve the original integrity of the group, I ask that you follow a few ground rules:  (1) You MUST include a photo of your real, actual human self.  Unless you really ARE  Darth Vader, a cute puppy, or the Manhattan skyline at sunset, please get a different picture.  (2) Answer the membership questions.   (3)  Keep your RSVP status updated.  If you are one of those Meetup creepers that RSVP for everything and repeatedly flake at the last minute, you may be dropped from the group.

results.description:
Kizomba/Semba Classes & Events by David Campos & Guida Rei in NEW JERSEY AREA

☞ What is Kizomba – The Origin

Kizomba is a breath whose rhythm is a beating heart, and where the perfect connection between two dancers gives birth to harmony, exaltation of senses and sensuality" D. Campos

Kizomba (a word meaning "Party" in angola ) takes its origin from the Angolan dance Semba, which is also the origin of the Brazilian Samba.

It appeared at the end of 70’s – 80’s, while the young Angolans, although very attached to their traditional dance,sought a new musical identity, and finally found their inspiration and new voice at a concert given by Kassav, a famous French Caribbean Zouk band. Kizomba was born out of this new generation’s desire to bring a touch of sensuality and sweetness to their national Semba.

The influence of the Angolan Kizomba soon spread to all the African Lusophone countries such as Guinea Bisau, Cape Verde, Mozambique. From there the dance quickly found its ticket to Europe via Portugal, where it further developed, by all these Artists, teachers, choregraphers coming from
these Luso-African countries.

As it rapidly gained popularity, Portugal exported Kizomba to various countries in Europe such as France, Spain, Poland, Belgium, Danemark and England. Today it is rare to find a Latin dance party without Kizomba represented, as well as salsa or bachata.

This "African Tango Zouk", also called "Tango Lusophone" continues to conquer a growing audience of passionate dancers, eager for beauty of gesture and sensuality, but also the indispensable complexity of exchange and trust present in each motions of Kizomba.

This young dance of barely thirty years is booming today, and constantly evolving.

"Kizomba is a tribute to sensuality, an ode to love and sharing. A moment when the woman's beauty, enhanced by her partner, must embody all its essence. " D. Campos

Be the pioneers here in the U.S. of a dance that will become soon a must for your dancing nightlife !!!
results.name: kizomba/semba in New Jersey

It's based on science that shows exercise is an optimal time to create and focus and form new neural pathways in your brain. So you get a great work out while rewiring your brain for success!! results.description:
PRYSMS ( Parent Resources Yielding Success of Multicultural Students) 

Our mission is to foster and promote greater academic achievement, social awareness and emotional intelligence of children from culturally diverse backgrounds in the school environment. 

We support families from NYC and throughout Long Island using a multicultural lens to prepare our children for success. Since the start of the school year PRYSMS has been busy planning events and activities for students and parents.  In September, we hosted a Back to School Meet and Greet and in November, a Family Symposium on “Nurturing a Positive Cultural Identity in Children”.

While parents are engaged in our General Meetings, children participate in our “Walk in My Shoes” Series, where they are in dialogue with High School students, College Students and recent College Graduates about their “walk” to success. They aslo participate in age appropriate, culturally relevant activities that promote a greater sense of self.

We welcome you to join us. Please feel free to peruse our website (PRYSMS4U.org) 

“PRYSMS is more than just an acronym.  PRYSMS is the action that will help future generations actualize the "American Dream" regardless of the obstacles laid before them.  It is providing resources, breaking down barriers, empowering families, building communities, strengthening the esteem in our sons and daughters...all using a multicultural lens to prepare our children for success”.

~~Tyra M. Banks 

Founder & President
results.name: PRYSMS - A Parent Resource Group

We read the classics. You know how everyone who has seen Hackers knows that "they're trashing our rights!" means to look for clues in the trashcan, and everyone who has read Marmion knows that if someone is weaving a tangled web it means that they are telling many lies? We're like that, but for programming. Join us as we read all the snippets of code that we take for granted but never have the time to read, compare, contrast, re-write, and re-imagine.

We're importing the Classical Code Reading Group of Stockholm to the good ol' U.S. of A.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Group Tuesdays from 7:00 to 8:30 PM The serene and peaceful waterside setting of Wainwright House provides a wonderful environment to study the Course. A Course in Miracles is a complete self-study spiritual thought system based on universal spiritual themes. Our group meets to read and discuss the principles that make up the Daily Lessons, the Text, and the Manual for Teachers. For the purpose of shared reading, we recommend that members bring the book titled, A Course in Miracles, Published by the Foundation for Inner Peace, Combined Volume.

 The Course does not aim at teaching the meaning of love, for that is beyond what can be taught. It does aim, however, at removing the blocks to the awareness of love's presence, which is your natural inheritance. This course can therefore be summed up very simply in this way: Nothing real can be threatened. Nothing unreal exists. Herein lies the peace of God.

 All are welcome to join us in this gentle and relaxed setting of learners.$5 donation for room. For more information, please contact acimgroup@yahoo.com Wainwright House is located at 260 Stuyvesant Ave, Rye NY (914)967-6080
results.name: A Course in Miracles at Wainwright House, Rye NY

Feel free to connect with me on Facebook via this link: https://www.facebook.com/ginamarie.ramirez.7 if you're unable to attend the meetups but would still like to benefit from what the group has to offer. I look forward to connecting with you in the near future! :)

results.description:
Are you thinking about jumping into the hottest real estate market?  Our home buyer workshops will cover key questions prospective homebuyers should ask as they prepare to make the largest financial purchase of their lives. We outline the steps to buying a home in New York City and provide practical and informative advice from industry insiders and veterans. 
 
Topics covered in our workshops include:
* How much money do I need to buy a home in NYC?
* Mortgage payment versus rent - similarities/differences; pros/cons
* Bank criteria for loan applicants
* Down payment assistance (for eligible purchasers)
* What does a [real estate agent/ real estate attorney/ mortgage banker] do for me?  
* Insider knowledge on how to pick the best agent/ attorney and mortgage professional
* Pros and cons of purchasing different types of homes
* Condominiums vs Cooperatives; the differences, formation, governance, common charges etc.
* An overview of terminology  homebuyers will hear during the home buying process
* Post Closing-after you own, what to be careful with once you own the home including rental collection, being a landlord, maintenance

You can't afford not to attend our meet-ups!!!!
results.name: Insider Tips for New York Real Estate Home Buyers

results.description: The Universal Negro Improvement Association & African Communities’ League is a social, friendly, humanitarian, charitable, educational, institutional, constructive, spiritually governing ruling body, and is founded by persons, desiring to the utmost, to work for the general uplift of the Negro peoples of the world. And the members pledge themselves to do all in their power to conserve the rights of their noble race and to respect the rights of all mankind, believing always in the Brotherhood of Man and the Fatherhood of God. MISSION STATEMENT The Universal Negro Improvement Association and African Communities League is a provisional government lead by a spiritual ruling governing body that is established for the purpose of the general uplift of the Black race. In keeping with this purpose our goals involve activities aimed at relieving the sufferings of the Black race and include the following: - Education and Training - Nutrition and Healthcare - Housing - Arts and Humanities - Agronomy and Applied Sciences - Building and Trades - Manufacturing - Economic Development The motto of the organization is: “One God! One Aim! One Destiny!” Therefore, let justice be done to all mankind, realizing that if the strong oppresses the weak confusion and discontent will ever mark the path of man, but with love, faith and charity towards all the reign of peace and plenty will be herded into the world and the generations of men shall be called blessed.

results.description:
Are you a women, age 50 or over, with a sense of adventure and a “bucket list” of things you’d like to experience? 

Do you have a desire to connect and make new friends with like minded women our age?

Are you looking for a place to share good times doing the things you’ve always loved?

If so, you’ve come to the right place!  Baby Boomer Women Social is a group designed to foster lasting friendships among vibrant, spirited women who have a desire to partcipate in a wide range of activities that pique our interests, expand our horizons, rejuvenate our minds and bodies, and unleash our passions. 

• Discover your "inner artist" at an Art and Wine Party …

• Escape for a weekend “self-renewal” retreat  …

• Bring out your "zany side" during an afternoon of improv …

• Enjoy dinner and the theater or a lively game of BUNCO over drinks and hors d’eourves …

• Spend a rejuvenating day at the spa … 

• Learn what it’s like to dance like a Rockette … 

• Try something a little more daring like parasailing (or cheer the group on from a seat in the boat) … 

• Share your passion for Impressionism during a trip to the art museum or your love of Puccini during a night at the opera ... 

• Join us in an activity that sparks your imagination or just sounds like fun!

In the words of Eleanor Roosevelt, “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” 

PLEASE NOTE: Baby Boomer Women Social is a friendly, supportive, fun-loving group of women that has traditionally had an "open door" policy when it comes to membership. Unfortunately, this policy was abused by some unscrupulous individuals.  We were able to obtain sufficient information to allow Meetup to identify those individuals and ban them from the site.  However, after careful consideration and at the suggestion of Meetup's Trust and Safety Team, new policies have been implemented in an effort to protect the privacy and security of our members from unwelcome and inappropriate solicitation going forward to the extent that it is possible on the Internet, and in an effort to allow all members of our group to socialize and communicate freely with one another without fear of harassment.  To that end, effective June 16, 2015, women who are interested in joining our group must first request to become a member and be approved before gaining access to our site. When you request to become a member of Baby Boomer Women Social, you will simply be asked to answer a few brief questions and upload an appropriate photo of yourself. Photos of animals, flowers, signs, "stock photos", portions of your body (i.e., your eye) or photos that are decades old, mask your face and/or make it impossible to identify you are not considered appropriate. Regretfully, any request that fails to provide appropriate answers and an appropriate photo will be denied. 

     This is by no means an indication that Baby Boomer Women Social is a "cliquish" group. Indeed, we welcome new members and we hope that these new policies will not deter you from joining us!
results.name: Baby Boomer Women Social: To Enrich the Midlife Journey

results.description: The “INSIGHT CAFE” is a safe, fun, social conversation group where members gather to explore and discuss thought-provoking topics such as “What IS our purpose in life?” or “The meaning of MY existence”. Members (“Wonderers”) are provided with ther resources to create or reformulate their personalized "Magic P. I. L. L." (Purpose In Life Legacy). While ideas and viewpoints from fields that include psychology, philosophy, sociology, religion, science - even the metaphysical, are open to discussion, no formal or specialized knowledge is required to participate. All that's requested is that you have a sense of curiosity, be open-minded, and respectful of other members' opinions and feelings. Meetings will include: open discussions, informative multi-media presentations, special guest speakers, and “Q and A” sessions on related topics and issues. Attendees will also discover “sources for resources” which they can review, with the opportunity to purchase, materials or services they deem interesting, entertaining, or beneficial. Best of all, the opportunity to relate to others and form new friendships (possibly meaningful, long-lasting relationships) is definitely not out of the question either!

results.description:
The Pleasure Salon was founded in 2007 to build community, allowing sex-positive people to cross-pollinate. Our gatherings bring together members of the BDSM, swinger, alternative gender, LGBTQ, sex educator, nudist, sex-magic, polyamory, Pagan, radical faerie, tantra, sex-blogger, porn, pervert and sex-worker communities, and others whose passion is sex. We hold monthly gatherings which are ideal places to meet others, whether you're new to New York City, or just looking to meet like-minded people.

Through building networks in the pleasure-positive community, Pleasure Salon hopes to help create a sex-positive world. It is a place for the open exchange of ideas. Join us in building New York's pleasure positive community, and bring your like-minded friends to this meet and greet. Pleasure Salon embraces respect, acceptance, and non-judgmental support in this public space. 

You should join us if you:

- have a clear photo of yourself in your profile.

- are willing to submit thoughtful responses to our membership questions

- are willing to talk to interesting people.

- new to an alternative lifestyle and would love to discuss it.

- are interested in belonging to a great community.
results.name: Pleasure Salon NY

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to provide a space for wellness oriented individuals to come together to participate in wellness & community oriented group activities, sessions and workshops including topics on health, wellness, nutrition, and the mind-body connection. There are a lot of options to exercise the body; we strive to help keep the brain healthy!

Let's make in-person social networking for fun, affordable activities in our neighborhood a priority! Love board games/strategy games/word games/card games? Seek puzzles and other mental challenges? Any member of this group may schedule a Meetup to play the any of the games in our studio collection (35+ games and counting!). Schedule your own game to find players. Set the date, start to end time, # of players and skill level required and away you go! This site does not promote gambling; Games are friendly and for entertainment only. 

Get together for family time at our reading lounge, indoor picnics with other kids and families, and play dates. Drop-in our studio on Saturday or Sunday - books, tea, activities, games available. We can also have events for just the ladies, like moms night-out, book club discussions, knitting/crocheting and anything else that looks like fun. Be smart! Get creative. Get social. Join us!
results.name: Bergen County Wellness, Brain Fitness & Community Meetup

results.description: This groups mission is to meet the group-running needs of those who do not work normal 9-5 hours and still want to participate in the enormous New York group running culture. I began marathon running in 2010 and consider running a bit of an obsession. After starting a job in management consulting, I found it difficult to consistently attend any existing running group sessions, as most did not accommodate my unique working hours. I tend to hit the pavement by 6am for morning runs, an after 8pm for post-work runs. I also live and work in the financial district, and have found few groups who meet in my neighborhood. This group will meet rather early or late, depending on the day, for group runs at moderate (weekend warrior) pace runs. We will run primarily out-and-back and loop runs that start and end in the financial district, and can be more creative on weekend runs. The goal is to accommodate athletes who work abnormal hours and provide the valuable benefits of a running community for those with even the most demanding work schedule.
results.name: NY After-Hours Runner

results.description:
Welcome to the Drunk History Book Club!  Each month we select a different title and get together for an informal discussion.

The Books

We rotate through three types of history:

• Near: NYC history

• Far: US history

• Really far: anywhere outside the US

Towards the end of each meetup we select the title or subject for next month.  Check out the About page for ideas.

The Venues

Bars, obviously.  We try to pick venues related to the current book selection (themes, neighborhoods, etc.).  We prefer places that are close to a major subway line and are cool with people who may not want to drink.

The Group

All are welcome.  We love different backgrounds, points of view, and takes on history.  Even if you didn’t finish the book -- some of the selections can be long and dry and we completely understand if you can’t get through it in a month.  Our only rules: respect the opinions of others and respect the booze.
results.name: Drunk History Book Club - Brooklyn

results.description:
Welcome to Tinkergarten Manhattan! 

Do you wonder if the unbridled, outdoor play that used to be part of the fabric of growing up has been lost? At Tinkergarten, we know that is where true learning happens, so we’re here to bring it back!

As a member of this group, you'll be invited to join us for free trial classes and special events in Central Park, and other parts of the city. You'll meet other parents who believe in learning through play and outdoor adventure. We'll also share outdoor DIY activity ideas, and let you know about new classes  starting in your area.

Those who have been members for a while will note that we began as Tinkergarten Central Park - UWS & UES.  We intended to use the group to share outdoor DIY activity ideas, and inform people about upcoming classes, including free events in Central Park for UWS and UES families (and those willing to travel). 

The good news? We're going to keep doing all of that -- we're just expanding our reach so we can share Tinkergarten with more kids and families, in more parts of the city we love.

We'd love you to join our community. Then, take your kids outside and play!

To get ideas for fun outdoor activities: http://www.tinkergarten.com

If you're interested in leading classes at your community: http://tinkergarten.com/leader/

To get in touch, email kate@tinkergarten.com
results.name: Tinkergarten Manhattan

results.description:
Anyone who follows the daily happenings of technology knows that it’s fascinating and debate inducing. The constant headlines of change and disruption is enough to leave anyone with more questions than answers.

While its natural to internalize and apply ones thinking to his/her own interests, experts agree that it's also important to understand a view that is larger than that which transcends our own interests. The Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp is an event where we encourage a community of entrepreneurs, investors and professional service providers, among others, in New York City to learn, think about and have dialogue on technology’s future impact on society. How will driverless cars affect the insurance industry? Is space exploration a needed component to our nations future? Is there such thing as privacy?

In order to reach an understanding, the Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp invites our country’s foremost experts to tackle these topics. But we also need YOU, to bring your background and point of view. This MeetUp is not meant to answer all the questions and solidify the solutions, rather its purpose is to foster the conversations and facilitate discussions around the topics.

If you're an entrepreneur, tech professional, or anyone genuinely interested how technology will affect society, this MeetUp is an opportunity to listen and learn, exchange ideas and network with liked-minded individuals.

We hope you will join us. Stay tuned for our first monthly meetup happening soon!
results.name: Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp

results.description: Hi everyone! I'm Francesca - a 45 year old mom living in Maplewood. As a plus-sized woman, it's harder for me to find a network of like-minded women who come across the same challenges as I do in life... everything from shopping for clothes, to fitting in movie theater seats, to exercise. Resources for larger women are slim to none (pun intended!). Therefore, I want to create a network of plus sized women that are a RESOURCE FOR EACH OTHER. I want to build strong friendships, have fun with people who feel comfortable around each other, and provide an ample shoulder to lean on when times get tough. THIS GROUP IS NOT FOR BBW ADMIRERS!! This group is for plus sized women who want to do the following with each other: - shopping... at stores where clothes fit us! - fun outings... where the activity level fits our needs and abilities! - movies... with people who understand that we need a seat in between each other, and don't feel weird about it! - dinner out... without anyone looking at your plate and wondering if you should "really be eating that!" - fitness...without judgement, at a pace and level that works for each person! - FEEL FREE TO BE 100% WHO WE ARE AROUND EACH OTHER! I live in Maplewood but work in Piscataway, so meet ups will be in central & Northern NJ, as well as NYC, which I LOVE! Looking forward to meet you!
results.name: BBW Having Fun & Making Friends (Women Only)

The running community is a very generous one and I have gained so much by being part of this wonderful community. If you know anyone who is interested in joining up send them my way!

results.description:
(Please read the description below completely . Thanks) 

We're a diverse group of women of all backgrounds, races, and walks of life, who just so happen to feel more comfortable in the “cool” crowd... if you know what I mean.

I plan on keeping this group uber small, and the events even smaller, so to improve your chances of acceptance, show us your personality by answering all profile questions to the best of your ability, and by including a clear photo of yourself.

Don't let the title fool you in to thinking we're not about making bona fide friendships; hopefully friendships that go way beyond meetup.

Requirements

• Must be attractive - I'm obviously not talking super model gorgeous here. I just mean cute and well put together. Don't be intimated to join. This is a sisterhood!

• Must upload clear, close, and recent photo of yourself as well as answer all questions.  (No pics of babbling brooks or rolling hills, although, I'm a sucker for pretty landscapes.)

• Must be between the ages of 21-35ish :)

• Must be fun and outgoing. (Sorry, No wallflowers). Only POSITIVE, upbeat personalities please.

• Must be sweet, caring, and willing to form genuine friendships.

• Must not be socially awkward in a group setting. 

• Must not be self-absorbed, rude or anything else in that vein. This isn't a group for mean girls, just a group of women who truly want to form genuine relationships, whether we're hitting a club, picnicking in the park, or hanging out at one another's apartments.

• MUST BE AN ACTIVE MEMBER. The point is to actually see you. This is a small group, so inactive members will be deleted after TWO Months.

Let's just have fun in the city! Please Join.
results.name: Young, Fun, and Attractive Women in the City

results.description:
Visit us on FaceBook!!  - facebook.com/NJTeamDragons


Dragon Boat is a fast growing, international team sport which offers a full-body workout, competitive spirit, and a summer tan. 

Team Dragons invites all ACTIVE Guys, Women, and Teens (16+ & up).  No paddling experience is necessary to try AND LOVE this exciting, adrenaline pumping sport! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cqqQGRZHZ2k

A dragon boat is basically a long canoe with a dragon head in the front and tail in the back. The crew consists of 20 paddlers - 10 on the left, 10 on the right, 1 drummer in the front of the boat, and 1 steersman in the back.  Most races are 200m, 500m, 1000m, or 2000 meters long.  When you have 20 people paddle in synch, the boat can move as fast as 15 MPH!


The NJ Dragon Boat Club consists of 3 types of crews to choose from:

• Team Dragons, a mixed crew competitive Racing team

• Mixed recreational team

• Team SOS Pathways, an all women breast cancer survivor team


We supply all the equipment and training. Our season starts on water from April and ends around October and usually practice 2 to 3 times a week.   This is GREAT for those weekend warriors as well!

We know everybody has a busy life, so practice is not mandatory unless you sign up for the Dragon Boat Races. We usually plan for 4 Races every season. Last year, we competed in Baltimore MD, Princeton NJ, Hartford CT and Montreal Canada with medals and trophies as return for all the hard work you commit and put in.

If you are looking for exercise and want to meet new people in a co-ed team sport environment (recreational or competitive), contact New Jersey Dragon Boat Club for more information.  Our members are from 14 years old to 65 years old.

 For more information go to facebook.com/NJTeamDragons and njdragonboat.org

Contact Team Managers Alain and Don at njteamdragons@gmail.com for more details.


Please complete and bring this WAIVER (linked) for each individual.

See ya'll dockside!
results.name: New Jersey Dragon Boat Club

If you are in the process of coming out as lesbian, bisexual, pansexual, queer or simply as a "woman who loves women," this group is a safe place to explore your emerging identity, however you choose to label it... or not. Whether you want to participate in social get-togethers or join a peer-counseled group discussing gay relationships and identity, you're in the right spot. 

Drop me a line if you have any suggestions for MeetUps or questions if you are new to the queer lifestyle. 

Cheers,

Jan

P.S. Notice that I've used just about every "label" in the book to describe your possible orientation, but in the end it's up to you in how you identify.

results.description:
Practice capturing the depth of a human face through paint or pencil. Perhaps travel to another city/country, in order to do so. Diversity highly, HIGHLY encouraged, please.

THE GOAL: 

• Artists serious about refining portrait skills spend hours discovering and perfecting a live human face. 

• A volunteer (face) model/member holds a series of expressions/facial poses, which will be captured by photographs shared during rest periods. 

• Artists develop their skills through speed sketching, live drawing, and then long periods of refining based on memory and photographic references.  

------------------------------------  

NEEDED PER SESSION: 

•  (1) Volunteer face model (member faces welcome, cross-America locations welcome)* 

•  (1) Volunteer photographer (develop your portrait photography skills with us!)* 

•  (1) Safe, public studio space with detail-friendly lighting** 


* Please send photo (of self if volunteering as model, of work if volunteering as photographer) as application. 

** Sessions will charge $15/person if space requires a fee. In my ideal world, this space is as super free as possible. 

------------------------------------ 

Donations in general will be encouraged to thank our volunteers, or to provide for food/drinks.

In the beginning this may just be me. So if you are a member that wants to be drawn or painted, I encourage your participation.

Welcome to the Best Single Travel Meetup!

We are a travel singles group with trips and cruises around the world.Since meetup doesn't show our posts to you, until it is only a few weeks away, I just wanted to let you know all about our upcoming trips with plenty of time to plan and dream.

For all of our Single land tours and Single Cruises, we provide a tour leader that is with you the entire time, free roommate matching , so you never have to pay a single supplement (unless of course you want to), and a small group atmosphere.

Some of the Single Cruises we have planned are Mediterranean cruises, Caribbean Cruises, Alaska, Japan, and even an Australia Cruise. In addition to what's offered above, many of the cruises include shore excursions and even a free perk on-board. (free beverages, free wi-fi, free specialty dining). You will want to book soon, as prices are always changing. Here is the link to all of our amazing cruises http://www.bestsingletravel.com/single_cruises.html


Our Singles land trips are usually a week to 10 days long and encompass at least one weekend. We offer land trips all over the world, including, Costa Rica, African Safari, Eastern Europe, Israel, and Greece. We also offer all-inclusive vacations in Cancun. To see a list of all of our land trips click here http://www.bestsingletravel.com/40s-50s-60s-trips.html


If you wish to be add to our email list and be updated as soon as we post a new trip or sale, forward us your email address -just reply to this email or email us at travel@bestsingletravel.com
There are over 10,000 members in our Singles Travel Group - https://www.facebook.com/groups/singlestravels/ If you are not a member you are missing out.

Please let me know if you have any questions or need help booking any of our wonderful vacations call us at (877) 848-7477. Looking forward to traveling with you.

Sheryl

Aleinu is an ever-changing, ever-growing group of young people in their 20s and 30s who meet regularly for Friday night services, social events and social justice.

cbst.org/aleinu

Aleinu hosts topical, social, and cultural events focusing on LGBTQ people in their 20s and 30s. Our programming welcomes couples, singles, all ages and genders.

Congregation Beit Simchat Torah (CBST) is a vibrant spiritual community and a progressive voice within ‎Judaism. Founded in 1973, CBST attracts and welcomes gay men, lesbians, bisexuals, transgender, ‎queer and straight individuals and families who share common values.

results.description:
Oneness Connecticut hosts weekly Blessing Circles and classes to initiate and support a process of awakening and growing — internally, professionally, and in relationships. Non-denominational and undogmatic, the worldwide Oneness Blessing phenomenon attracts  participants of all ages from all walks of life and beliefs (or non-beliefs) who bond over  a common desire for something more in life. 

The blessing is a brief, light laying on of hands of subtle energies transmitted by Oneness Blessing Givers that initiate a neurophysical change in the brain, declutching the mind and quieting inner chatter and divisiveness. Participants experience deep inner peace and expansiveness during the process, resulting in growing clarity, inner peace, self-acceptance, personal breakthroughs, and miracles. 

The evening includes a chakra meditation to raise kundalini (energy) and a discussion or Q&A period. During the blessing, you just sit in a chair with your eyes closed, listen to beautiful music, and receive multiple transmissions of grace. The experience is often sublime, and always tailored to exactly what it is that you need next in your life.
results.name: Oneness Connecticut Blessing Circles

results.description:
The goals of the code jam are to:

1.  A networking event where technologists can meet other colleagues and network throughout the industry.

2.  Create a new product using unknown or newer technologies.

3.  Give working technologists additional portfolio pieces to assist with their skillsets and their careers.


This "Code Jam" is a weekly (or sometimes bi-weekly) event where the members of the group collaborate and build a product known as an MVP or (Minimum Viable Product).   Each organizer may invite up to 4 additional engineers or entrepreneurs who wish to participate on an ongoing basis.  All work is voluntary as this is a professional growth and network experience for all involved. 

During the process, the team will have the ability to investigate and prototype new technologies into the solution.   Product cycles are expected to take 4-8 weeks.


Beer, lunch, dinner and snacks provided as necessary.
results.name: NYC Technology Code Jam

results.description:
Welcome to the group, Reel Shooters! I'm looking for members who are hungry to be successful in the entertainment industry. All actors and crew members, whether motivated newbies or experienced talent, are welcomed to join.

My experience, with several film meetup groups, is that everyone is overly-ambitious at the inception. Many times, the group attempts to complete only one project (successfully or unsuccessfully), then everyone disappears into oblivion. Many actors stray away to other projects, hoping it could be their big break. Projects crumble. There is no business savvy to take a completed project to the next level. Etc Etc. Hopefully, this group will be different from the norm.

My intention is to propel this group towards the online media platform. I personally don't want this group to be working for free all the time, grovelling for attention at mediocre film festivals, begging for money on Kickstarter or IndieGogo or be a total waste of time, effort and labor. Creating content online is the only smart way for independent filmmakers to fully explore their creativity, maintain ownership, become recognized for their hard work and generate revenue for their projects, without experiencing the hassles of the industry. The big guys come to you after. I know this because I've seen this happen thousands of times with online talent. Simply because, these guys are perfecting their own talent and individual brand, and not grovelling to please anyone. 

Personally, I'm a highly efficient, determined and organized individual. Within 7 months, I've already worked on a national Dunkin Donuts commercial, worked with the brilliant veteran actress Judith Roberts, became a verified YouTube Partner and have 10 episodes in Post Production of my first web series, whilst juggling my day job and social life. If you think the same and don't make excuses, not only will we get along great, but we will be closer to "REEL" success!

In this group, you will have an opportunity to collaborate with each other. I, also, have several projects in the pipeline, so there will always be something to work on. Everyone will be properly credited on IMDB as well.

Here are a list of issues that will get you banned from the group:

-If there is any form of member harassment, you will be banned.

-If you flake without reason, you will be banned.

-If you never contribute to the group, you will be banned. I'm very meticulous about people lurking around with the possible intention of taking our ideas. Even if you can't attend production meetings or the actual shoot, contributions can range from feedback, constructive criticism, editing, scoring, designing posters etc.

-If you don't answer the intro questions, you will be denied entry into the group.


Anyways, that's enough of me blabbering for now. Thanks, and welcome to the group!

-Nash.

(Director, Writer, Motion Graphics Designer)
results.name: REEL Shooters

results.description:
This is the official meetup page of Bubble Soccer NYC (http://www.bubbleballsoccernyc.com)

More fun than soccer, safer than football, cheaper than hockey, and bouncier than basketball. BubbleBall guarantees to make you spin, bounce and laugh like no other sport in history! 


What is Bubble Ball Soccer?

Bubble soccer (also known as “Boblefotball” "bubble football" "bumperz" and "bubble ball") is the brainchild of Henrik Elvestad and Johan Goldenfirst. The first game appeared on Golden Goal, a Norwegian TV show, in 2011. Since then it has rapidly spread like wildfire throughout the world and finally, Bubble Ball Soccer has landed in NYC (the tri-state area). 

To play, teams of up to ten players don typical soccer/sports clothing and put their giant bubble ball suits (loosely described as giant, inflatable hamster balls) on top. Each suit is very safe and is designed for any type of weather or outdoor arena.They have a built in backpack style harness so you can strap the balls on, and handles to allow for pain free spills, hard tackling, bumping, knocking, bouncing and rolling.

Don't worry though, you won't get a yellow card for this type of behavior. Bubble ball soccer is a full contact sport and there are no tackling fouls to be heard of. Roughhousing is actually encouraged and what makes bubble ball soccer so much fun! The balls will absorb the tackle and do what it does best, bounce back and bring you to your feet without causing you any harm, pain or injury!

So, what are the actual rules? Simple - keep the balls in bounds and score! This is a lot harder than it looks (actually it doesn't look easy at all) and as a result most games end up with only a few goals. Despite this fact, it's still a very entertaining game to watch and even more fun to play. Expect to burn up to 1000 calories, sweat, laugh, get some aggression out and experience withdrawal symptoms until your next round!
results.name: NYC Bubble Ball

results.description:
Ever wanted to be a full stack developer? We here at developer unicorns will teach you the ins and outs of full stack awesomeness. Learn - python, javascript, ruby, mobile development, hardware hacking and more!


* Who should join: 

We have three types of members: 

1)   Those trying to learn to code. 

2)  Those strong in one area (like frontend development) but looking to grow in other areas

3)  Those already strong in general (like an average full stack developer) but looking to stay current with tools in the field

  
* Why should members join: 

The central goal of Developer Unicorns is to create a group of people who keep each other abreast of the most current technologies in the world of mobile and web development.  This includes front end, backend, big data, and industry specific knowledge.  

Members should join if they want to meet other folks trying to learn more about software development, if they want to make new friends in the tech space, or if they just love learning about current technology.


* What can members expect out of the group: 

There are two types of events that our community holds regularly - lecture style talks and workshop style events.

During the lecture style talks a topic is introduced and a lecture is given.  This covers a high level overview of the topic and shows you some examples of how to use the technology being discussed.  This could be a technology stack, a design pattern, a new language, a framework, or a new piece of hardware, etc.  

During the workshop style event members are given the option to work on discrete exercises or hack on their own project using the topic discussed during the previous lecture style talk.  This way any skills are reinforced AND the members with more questions can ask the lecturer something specific.
results.name: Developer Unicorns

results.description:
Creativity is intelligence having fun.  Albert Einstein

This is a fun and energetic group of like minded paper artists. We meet once a month to stamp and learn new techniques, have great food and share ideas.

Are you a creative mogul or do you not feel creative one bit?? This group has something for everyone who loves to craft with paper. Learn some tips and tricks from a Stampin' Up! Professional, while hanging out with new friends making cards, hand made gifts and more!! The possibilities are endless... I like to call these events "Girl's Night Out" because I want you to feel like you are pampered!

I thoroughly enjoy teaching new techniques, stamping with my friends, and making various home decor items using rubber stamps, die cuts, and beautiful papers.  Join my monthly classes for inspiration, socialization, or to learn something new!  

I have several ideas for upcoming meetups -- some will be classes where we will make several cards or a home decor item, and others will be an open house style where you can each bring your own paper crafting projects, and you can use all of my non-consumables such as punches, the Big Shot die cutting machine (and all the many dies I have), stamps, and ink.  I will provide great snacks (usually involves CHOCOLATE in one form or another) and drinks, and assist you with your creative projects.  Each class will be priced according to materials involved.
I hope you will join me and I look forward to meeting some new friends who share this hobby!

Stampingly,

Selene Ferguson
results.name: South Shore Stampin Haven

results.description:
We're a group of people who use self observation an anthropomorphism to improve any part of our lives.  It should be also fun and easy! We gather in Manhattan for workshops or meetings in the park or other interesting venues. 

A big part of what we explore are the relationships we have with the different topics in our lives. That's why we use anthropomorphism! Tapping into - and using - this cognitive process leads to more influence, understanding and happiness in our lives.



The I Philosophy:

'Talking to yourself' That's sound weird right? But we do talk to ourselves all the time. We've got these little voices in our heads like in the new Pixar movie 'Inside out (trailer)'.


Why we are a big fan of this movie?

Every sensation we experience; thoughts, feelings etc. are all a vital parts of the system that we are. Seeing ourselves as a running system is the answer to improve our lives. For example it is great to see in the movie that Sadness and Anger are as important as Joy for the whole happiness of the main character..! This totally corresponds with the I Philosophy.

Eva Helmond developed this pragmatic, easy and fun method to explore the relationship with certain topics in your life in 2013. She moved from Amsterdam to NY where I Philosophy is a big success.

Walk & talks (workshops while walking): they begin again in April in Central Park
results.name: I philosophy NYC

results.description:
Whatever you love, somebody is making a living doing that very thing. Entrepreneurship is the wave of  the future. You can learn to earn your living by living your dream. What To Do With Your Life is a coaching experience designed to assist you in finding the pieces of your life puzzle and then putting them together to design the career and lifestyle that fits you. As the jobs continue to disappear, you will be one of those fortunate people who has the tools to build your own future.

Every person has something that they can do supremely well, the thing they were born to do. If you find your vital function, and create the support system that allows you to perform that function freely, you can earn a good living, because you will be delivering tangible value to your fellow human beings. But, most people have lost touch with what they love, and have given up hope of reaching that kind of fulfillment.

We can't wait to meet you at our next event! Thank you.

"WE OWN" NYC

(WE OWN = Women’s Effect On the World’s Nations)

WE OWN the "RIGHT" to encourage women to live up to their full potential; full and healthy lives, rather than those limits which society has placed on them, or that, they have been conditioned to place on themselves. 

WE OWN the "RIGHT" to encourage women to learn from their mistakes, value their sense of self, love themselves, perceive the sky as their limit, and turn their dreams into reality. 

WE OWN the "RIGHT" to encourage women to exercise self-determination (ability to make choices), being aware that there are always options. 

YES!

WE OWN” "OUR" Dreams, Goals, Bodies, Abilities, Desires, Competencies, and for darn sure the “RIGHT” to make "OUR" Own Decisions, Support each other, Have fun, and Succeed in the process.

THIS IS "OUR" WORLD DAMNIT! 

Let's Leave A Footprint Where Others Can See It.

PS:

GENTLEMEN! 

WE OWN'S intent is not to exclude you from the building process. You are welcome to work with and support your Women Peers/Colleagues. 

In fact, we encourage your support.

You are part of "OUR" world.

results.description:
This group promises to be more active and diverse than the typical expat meetup group.

While we'll also have the ubiquitous expat pub gathering, ours will happen more than once every three months. More importantly, we'll have more than just pub nights. And most importantly, everyone is welcome. Canadian or not. But be warned: chances are that you'll be outnumbered by Kannucks!

On variety and frequency... We already have two weekly events posted on our schedule and have had great turnouts so far.

Join us for Tuesday Night Street Hockey!

Or come on out for Thursday Night Crokinole! If you don't know Crokinole, it's a mid-1800s Canadian table-top game, which is perhaps most similar to shuffleboard. It's easy to pick up and well social.

In the near future, you should also expect the following such things from this group:

• Outings to NHL games, to the Catskills for snowshoeing, and to NYC Beer Week.

• Opportunities to play soccer with (and against) other Canadians in charity tournaments and leagues.

• Information about how to get involved in the local community by volunteering with award-winning non-profits - some of which are run by Canadians living in New York.

• Myriad other ways to get involved in local life with like-minded Canadians and non-Canadians.

Join us and jump in this Thursday's Crokinole session! There's perhaps no better way to meet new people than over this classic Canadian fixture.
results.name: The Alternative Canadian Expat Meetup

results.description:
Tri-County Camera Club of New Jersey

We are one of the most active camera clubs in northern New Jersey. Our members join to learn about taking good photographs, to see the work of top photographers and to share their own photographic ideas. Our club has been home to outstanding photography for over 60 years, and has been meeting in Nutley, New Jersey since 1963.

Our goal is to learn and grow as photographers. This is accomplished as members exchange ideas, share experiences and offer technical advice. Outside experts are also brought in to offer workshops and demonstrations.

We are a member of New Jersey Federation of Camera Clubs (NJFCC) and the Photographic Society of America (PSA). As a club, we have successfully participated in competitions held within both organizations and received not only club recognition, but also individual ribbons, medals and trophies.

results.description:
Hello my lovely new friends! Please read the description all the way down, thank you.

I am a new business owner in the Central NJ area and this group is for my fellow new female business owners and/or professionals that are transitioning into entrepreneurship. Mastermind groups offer a combination of brainstorming, education, peer accountability, and support in a group setting to sharpen your business and personal skills. The main purpose of this group is to hold each member accountable to her goals, provide access to information/resources, and support. How may we serve you?

This group is for success-minded ladies who take full responsibility for their lives and are focused on solutions. We are made up of a diverse array of women. We will be small so we can develop a real community and connection.

*This group is not a company, we are not peddling services or products, and our meetings will not serve as a platform to advertise any companies or businesses*.

How it will work - The Roundtable

This group will meet at least once a week. Each lady will take a turn and speak about what she is working on, goals, and with what she needs help. Whenever a person is speaking, everybody else will be respectful and listen to her without judgment. Then for the next 20-30 minutes, the rest of us will brainstorm, share ideas, solutions, and constructive feedback towards a solution for her. Each lady will feel free to share as much or as little as she wants. This will not be a "woe is me" session and every lady will be safe to share herself without fear of being attacked or made to feel ridiculous.

Kindness above all else is our most valued principle.

After the meeting is over, we can leave, or just chat and get to know each other. Come prepared to laugh, form friendships, and have intelligent discussions with other incredible females.﻿
results.name: Millionaire Ladies' Mastermind Group

results.description:
NATURAL WAY OF LIVING was established by Irmansyah Effendi, M.Sc. in 2014 as a company that endeavors to help others to be physically, mentally, emotionally and spiritually healthier by using the physical body more in accordance with the way it was created by The Creator through organizing relevant workshops as well as training centers. 

The pioneering program from NATURAL WAY OF LIVING is the Secrets of Natural Walking™ (SONW) workshop that was officially launched in January 2014 in 3 major cities in Indonesia with more than 500 participants in total.  In an astonishingly short time frame, even before the workshop ends or just a few days afterwards, so many people have experience significant and tangible benefits. Workshop participants who needed surgery for their physical problems were healed. Others experienced better improvement in body shape and natural weight loss compared to routinely going to the gym 3-4x/week. Most people also enjoy feeling more refreshed and energetic in their daily lives.

Why is Secrets of Natural Walking So Effective?

Beyond a simple step

results.description:
The Major Meetup Network are leaders/assistant leaders of large meetups. We intend to build a critical mass of large meetups, defined as:

• 1,000 members or more
• Actively running events (at least 3 annually)
• Focused on technology, startups, marketing/media/social media, the future and socializing.
• Initially limited to the NY metro area and later expanding to other metro areas.
• Operating ethically.
• Not political or religious in nature. 


By virtue of our substantial combined membership and ability to segment as above, we can:
• Be more appealing to sponsors and related partners. Sponsors wanting to reach larger numbers than most meetups can provide will be able to justify an investment in our network.
o The same sponsor that wouldn’t find it worthwhile to support a 1,200 member group could be more interested in one with 25,000 or 50,000+.
• More easily co-promote or co-produce events with each other.
• Negotiate more effectively with venues.
• Draw speakers to New York for multiple meetups.
• Share ideas, resources and post inquiries among ourselves.
• Secure member benefits and perks not available to our separate meetups. We will meet periodically to review direction and make connections. 


Join us and benefit from the power of our network. Open to Organizers and Assistant Organizers of Meetups with 1,000 or more members, subject to the sole discretion of this meetup’s organizer.
results.name: Major Meetup Network

topics.name: MeetUp Organizers Co_Organizers and Event Hosts

Whether your group has futurist in its name or that is an important theme in your events, we welcome your participation.

results.description:
Visualize basketball (or soccer), but played on the river in between downtown Brooklyn and lower Manhattan, in a kayak. 

Now picture this for free!

Brooklyn Kayak Guides–in association with the Brooklyn Bridge Park Boathouse and Conservancy–is setting up kayak polo games on Sunday afternoons. We've got the equipment (kayaks, vests, helmets, paddles), you bring the body, enthusiasm, and sportsmanship (shorts/sandals, too). Your level of experience doesn't matter. Prepare to get addicted. Soon you'll be passing the ball like some aquatic-John Stockton. Do you whitewater? Paddle leisurely? Nothing will improve your kayaking skills as rapidly as playing this game. 

The catch? We're limited to 15 participants per game, so reserve your spot for the game at 11AM. We'll put you in a team and give you a vest number. First-come first-served basis. Dedicated players and volunteers, though, will end up being teachers to others. 

Season begins in early June (June 7th 2015) and goes on for all 12 Sundays, till late August. 

We focus on individual attention and kayak mentoring, and is the best free kayak learning experience you can get in NYC. It's from 11am-12PM. 

• Our Meetup game is 11AM-12PM. Arrive at least 30 minutes before game time to be donned with vest, helmet, paddle, and kayak. 

• We're at Brooklyn Bridge Park, on pier 2. The High St station (A/C line) is closest, and is a nice 20 minute walk to pier 2 (so, to be on time, you should be exiting the station at around 10:10am).

Get ready to have fun.
results.name: Brooklyn Kayak Polo

Hosted at Cabana Grill, a Fun & Friendly Dinner Dance Club.  Cabana Grill is a great place to meet and host our event.  The atmosphere is warm and friendly and the dance floor is open and big for a group of people to enjoy social and partner dancing.  So, if you are someone who would like to get out of the house and have a mid week "pick me up" to get through the rest of the week,  join a FUN GROUP of people who want to mix and mingle with dancing (Even if you don't know how) then this is the group for you.  We will be sure you learn the basics and some fun variations to put to the dance floor.  You don't need to come with a partner, both Singles and Couples are welcome to join.  If you love to dance or want to dance then STEP on down and give it a try!  look forward to seeing you next Wednesday!

Do you like anime, but tired of dealing with people who only concern themselves with 'localized' fandom? Want to talk about light novels? Obscure manga series? Currently airing anime? Seiyuu? Drama CD? Pixiv? 2ch? Niconico? Comiket? Doujin? Macross instead of Robotech?

Tasogare network seeks to be a gathering place for NYC anime enthusiasts who have great dedication to unabridged details and knowledge. Our main purposes are offline networking and information exchange - major activities are self introduction, group discussion, and presentation. We hope that this will lead to favorable social interactions and more sophisticated appreciation of japanese animation.


Please be aware that following directives will be strictly enforced:

* All media will be played in its original audio, with or without subtitles. No exception.

* Original name order of characters/persons will be preserved. Use UPPERCASE to indicate the surname if needed (ex. Ayanami Rei, AYANAMI Rei)

* Please refrain from cosplaying outside special events. Impress others with your words.

"I have no use for casuals.  If you are otaku, bilinguar, or hardcore, then come see me. That is all."

results.description:
**You acknowledge that you'll be an active member of this group by joining.**

I started this husky playtime group for some fun socialization lovers and companions of Siberian Huskies (and mixes). Socializing, husky interaction and etc. We host meet-ups throughout the new york city area almost every weekend. There are a lot of Huskies out there that need social interaction and can't get none such as my husky because they are known to play rough. Siberian huskies have lots of energy, play rough while socialize with other dogs. I'm hoping to bring together a group of husky and husky mixes for regular play dates to

1) run that energy off!

2) let them socialize with dogs their own breed, and temperament.

3) meet regularly enough that they bond with their playmates. Its for socializing, free and fun.

On Weekends, mostly Sunday!

We are now teaming up with Tyler from @nycdogmushers and intergrating dog sledding AKA "dryland mushing" as part of our meetups!

**You are responsible for your dogs' actions and their well being so make it a priority!**

NOTE:  We (group members) are professional guides and do not have certified training or insurance. Be aware, inherent hazards and risks are associated with walking, hiking and all other physical activities. You may participate with us in any activity but you do so at your own risk. You alone are responsible for your own safety and health. The more prepared you are, the better the chance you will remain safe. Your preparedness not only affects your safety but the safety and enjoyment of the whole group.

If you haven't attended a meetup within a year since you've joined you will be removed.

All events held are at you and your dog's own risk.

**I also ask if you choose not to attend an an event, please select not going as an option.**

By joining this group , you are agreeing to indemnify me and any other event host, and hold the event hosts harmless for whatever you, your dogs, your guests, may experience or cause at any of the events. We are merely participating in an activity ourselves and are simply inviting others to join in.

We’ll be presenting new developments in the language and tools, new frameworks, advanced animation techniques for great user interfaces and great new apps. For beginners, we’ll be discussing topics like functional programming, closures, optionals, and how memory management works in Swift. We want to build a great community that give support to developers as they learn the modern (and beautiful) new language that Apple has designed and created.

Hosts:
Aditya Narayan, is Co-Founder of Turn to Tech after having been Chief Architect at Marvel Entertainment & Head of Security Architecture at Starwood Hotels along with an Architect role at JP Morgan Chase. He holds an MS&BS in Physics from the Indian Institute of Technology. He also founded 1to1Tutor, a successful online Math company which has tutored over 25,000 students. Prior to that he created ‘InterStructures’ - the popular Windows-Linux interoperability platform and has various technology publications.

Michael Prenez-Isbell. Michael just left Conde Nast after 3 years as Manager for Mobile, working with brands like Vogue, Vanity Fair and The New Yorker, and hosted the New York iOS Developer’s Meetup quarterly in the Conde Nast auditorium.

results.description:
This is a Meetup for musicians and non-musicians alike who want to explore everything alt/indie/B-side in (mostly) music through playing acoustic music, attending live shows (including music-related films), and discussing books. Live performances/concerts will include folk, rock, pop, jazz, classical, world - as long as it's alt/indie/or B-side.  (See clarification below about the monthly jam.)

Monthly "B-Side" Acoustic Music Workshop: Each month, we will meet in a small group of up to about 14, divide into smaller groups of twos or threes to work on a songs collaboratively and then to perform them for the groups that same evening. They can be originals or covers, but We're aiming to play alternative/indie style music OR do alternative/indie/unique versions of classics. 

Clarification: 

Some people may be confused by the alt/indie/b-side thing.  To put it another way, it simply means bring something different!  While the emphasis is for more current alternative or indie singer songwriters/bands, b-side means we should also consider lesser known tracks from people/bands we all know and lover.  For example, here's a link to some not-often-played/covered Eagles songs    

http://ultimateclassicrock.com/most-underrated-eagles-songs/

Live Music/Arts Outings:  Ever want to attend go see a band like Belle & Sebastian, or the xx, Wilco - or maybe a cool film or art show? No problem! Each month, we will also offer up live music, art, or film outings. And if you want to add something to the calendar, all you need to do is e-mail me with the show you want to go and I will make you an assistant organizer or host for that show! We will try and mostly do venues that are not assigned seats so that we can hang out/talk before or during show. 

Bi-monthly Book Club: we will choose a music or arts related book and meet at various fun locations to read and discuss. Suggestions welcome!
